meanings.definition: Make a short, sharp sound, as a chicken does.
meanings.sent1: The hen will cluck when she sees her chicks.
meanings.sent2: Chickens often cluck when they are happy.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken cluck at the joke? Because it was egg-citing!
meanings.sent4: The sound of the chicken clucking echoed through the farm.
meanings.sent5: The clucking noise of the hen was a comforting sound in the barn.

meanings.definition: A short, sharp sound, as a chicken makes.
meanings.sent1: I heard the cluck of the chicken in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The farm was filled with the cheerful cluck of hens.
meanings.sent3: The cluck of the chicken interrupted the quiet of the morning.
meanings.sent4: The cluck of the hen was like a gentle alarm clock.
meanings.sent5: The familiar cluck of the chickens signaled the start of a new day.
